alert.note: Alert for Bolivar Peninsula; Brazoria Islands; Chambers; Coastal Brazoria; Coastal Galveston; Coastal Jackson; Coastal Matagorda; Galveston Island; Inland Brazoria; Inland Galveston; Inland Jackson; Inland Matagorda; Matagorda Islands (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 18 at 1:31PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...Line of Strong Thunderstorms Nearly to the Coast... At 130 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of High Island to Magnolia Beach. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Galveston Causeway, Galveston Island West End, Texas City, Matagorda, Lake Jackson, Alvin, Angleton, Dickinson, Bay City, La Marque, Port Lavaca, Santa Fe, Freeport, Clute, Hitchcock, Palacios, West Columbia, Sweeny, Surfside Beach and South Texas Nuclear Plant. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
